dependencies.description: Autoconf -- system configuration part of autotools
dependencies.name: autoconf

dependencies.description: Automake -- make file builder part of autotools
dependencies.name: automake

dependencies.description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.
dependencies.name: gmake

dependencies.description:
The GNU config.guess and config.sub scripts versioned by timestamp.
This package can be used as a build dependency for autotools packages
that ship a tarball with outdated config.guess and config.sub files.
dependencies.name: gnuconfig

dependencies.description:
GnuTLS is a secure communications library implementing the SSL, TLS and
DTLS protocols and technologies around them. It provides a simple C
language application programming interface (API) to access the secure
communications protocols as well as APIs to parse and write X.509, PKCS
#12, OpenPGP and other required structures. It is aimed to be portable
and efficient with focus on security and interoperability.
dependencies.name: gnutls

dependencies.description: libtool -- library building part of autotools.
dependencies.name: libtool

dependencies.description: GNU M4 is an implementation of the traditional Unix macro processor.
dependencies.name: m4

dependencies.description:
OpenSSL is an open source project that provides a robust, commercial-
grade, and full-featured toolkit for the Transport Layer Security (TLS)
and Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) protocols. It is also a general-purpose
cryptography library.
dependencies.name: openssl

dependencies.description:
An instrumentation framework for building dynamic analysis. There are
Valgrind tools that can automatically detect many memory management and
threading bugs, and profile your programs in detail. You can also use
Valgrind to build new tools. Valgrind is Open Source / Free Software,
and is freely available under the GNU General Public License, version 2.
dependencies.name: valgrind

description:
Librelp is an easy to use library for the RELP protocol. RELP (stands
for Reliable Event Logging Protocol) is a general-purpose, extensible
logging protocol.
name: librelp

variants.description: Build systems supported by the package
variants.name: build_system
